instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but restarts
threads.message:
Hello, I just got a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in, its like the 3rd in the last 2 months.

no signs of water damage or drops.
Upon inspection <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> seems to have some suspect looking balls.
just not shiny.

everything else looks good.

I was informed that the night before it startedto play up it had been left on the bed and was running and had a blanket on it.

I have had it running after a smc reset.
I run a program to monitor fan speed and temperature.
it seemed to run hot and it only showed cpu core 2 and cpu core 3.
Cores was running at 70+
I'm no macbook wiz.
I know window base laptops/computers.

anyway it is unstable. As it is doing the resetting again.

could it be a battery ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but restarts
threads.message:
Is it normal for it not to show all cores in temperature control program ?

my iMac shows all cores.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but restarts
threads.message:
Does it turn off, or restart?
Run ASD and see if any error pop out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but restarts
threads.message:
I cleaned the board, put some good thermopast on and put it back together.
its running and it passed ASD 
it was restarting.
stuck in boot loop.
and after a few restarts it would not turn on at all

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but restarts
threads.message:
Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> then.
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42?
